alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:28PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Red Willow and eastern Hitchcock Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 428 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Culbertson, or 9 miles east of Trenton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McCook. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
